author: michaelamadi
content:
Hello guys, been researching and reading on EOF and I've a question on something I don't fully understand yet.

Asides from code kinds which have a max num of 1024, there are container kinds which have a max num of 256 but are arranged/encoded similarly to code kinds in the header.

What are the differences between the 2? when would one use 1 over the other? Is one executable and the other not? A test example reference would be helpful too. 

Thanks

author: _shemnon
content: containers are only used for EOFCREATE and RETURNCONTRACT.  Your actual contract execution happens in the code sections.

content: You can look at the tests for immediatly available examples. https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eip7692%40v1.0.3 - smaller format focused on specific good/bad cases.  Another alternative is to use the prototype solidity compiler https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/solidity_eof_poc .
